001package org.consensusj.bitcoin.json.conversion;
002
003import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonParser;
004import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException;
005import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonToken;
006import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.DeserializationContext;
007import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonDeserializer;
008import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.exc.InvalidFormatException;
009import org.bitcoinj.base.Address;
010import org.bitcoinj.base.AddressParser;
011import org.bitcoinj.base.DefaultAddressParser;
012import org.bitcoinj.base.Network;
013import org.bitcoinj.base.exceptions.AddressFormatException;
014import org.bitcoinj.core.NetworkParameters;
015
016import java.io.IOException;
017
018/**
019 * Deserialize bitcoinj (family) addresses
020 */
021public class AddressDeserializer extends JsonDeserializer<Address> {
022    private final AddressParser.Strict addressParser;
023
024    /**
025     * Construct an address deserializer that will deserialize addresses for any of the default supported networks.
026     * See {@link NetworkParameters} to understand what the supported networks are.
027     */
028    public AddressDeserializer() {
029        this((s) -> new DefaultAddressParser().parseAddressAnyNetwork(s));
030    }
031
032    /**
033     * Construct an address deserializer that validates addresses for the specified {@link NetworkParameters}.
034     * When deserializing addresses, addresses that are not from the specified network will cause a
035     * {@link InvalidFormatException} to be thrown during deserialization.
036     *
037     * @param network Network id to specify the only network we will deserialize addresses for.
038     */
039    public AddressDeserializer(Network network) {
040        this((s) -> new DefaultAddressParser().parseAddress(s, network));
041    }
042
043    /**
044     * Construct an address deserializer that validates addresses for the specified {@link NetworkParameters}.
045     * When deserializing addresses, addresses that are not from the specified network will cause a
046     * {@link InvalidFormatException} to be thrown during deserialization.
047     *
048     * @param netParams Network parameters to specify the only network we will deserialize addresses for.
049     */
050    public AddressDeserializer(NetworkParameters netParams) {
051        this((netParams != null)
052                ? (s) -> new DefaultAddressParser().parseAddress(s, netParams.network())
053                : (s) -> new DefaultAddressParser().parseAddressAnyNetwork(s));
054    }
055
056    /**
057     * Construct an address deserializer with a custom {@link AddressParser}
058     * @param addressParser parser to convert a string to an address
059     */
060    public AddressDeserializer(AddressParser.Strict addressParser) {
061        this.addressParser = addressParser;
062    }
063
064    @Override
065    public Address deserialize(JsonParser p, DeserializationContext ctxt) throws IOException, JsonProcessingException {
066        JsonToken token = p.getCurrentToken();
067        switch (token) {
068            case VALUE_STRING:
069                try {
070                    return addressParser.parseAddress(p.getValueAsString());
071                } catch (AddressFormatException e) {
072                    throw new InvalidFormatException(p, "Invalid Address: " + p.getValueAsString(), p.getValueAsString(), Address.class);
073                }
074            default:
075                return (Address) ctxt.handleUnexpectedToken(Address.class, p);
076        }
077    }
078}
